summary: We testified about the Occupational Safety and Health Administration's efforts to protect workers from COVID-19 and its preparedness for a new crisis. For example, OSHA issued two emergency standards: one to protect health-care workers and another for vaccinations and testing at large employers. But, OSHA faced challenges implementing both standards and withdrew most of their provisions. Employers must report injury and illness data to OSHA...
title: Workplace Safety and Health: Data and Enforcement Challenges Limit OSHA's Ability to Protect Workers during a Crisis
